channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous pathway - needs urgent attention, 22nd February
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to raise an urgent safety concern regarding the public footpath that runs between the rear of the Pirton Fields development in Churchdown, Gloucester, and the old military homes and adjacent rugby/football fields. This pathway is heavily used by school children each day as a direct walking route to and from school. Unfortunately, its current condition is extremely poor and, in my opinion, unsafe. As shown in the attached photographs, the surface has become severely waterlogged and churned into deep mud. Large sections are slippery, uneven and difficult to walk across. I regularly walk my dogs along this route and frequently witness children struggling to navigate the path. Many are slipping, attempting to balance along the edges, or walking directly through standing water and thick mud. Their school shoes and clothing are being covered in mud, and they are left trying to clean themselves off before school. Given the volume of daily use by school pupils and members of the public, I believe this pathway requires urgent maintenance and review. This is not simply an inconvenience; it is a health and safety issue. I can see this has already been reported and nothing done as of yet. I would be grateful if this matter could be investigated as a priority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warrener Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on bus route, 22nd February
item.description:
Resident has reported this pothole Adjacent to 44 Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe It’s been growing bigger every day Just one of the many that are still yet to be done on Barnmeadow Road. This road is a part of the bus route and with the volume of traffic that comes through I’m not surprised this road is suffering with potholes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe

item.title: Parking review required, 22nd February
item.description:
Peak traffic is now so busy the council should consider either narrowing one side of the pavement or not allowing parking on both sides of the road. This is a regular bottle neck which causes issues with busses vans and Lorry’s. This is amplified when events are on in Cheltenham causing traffic backing up on to the roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
